content:
Hi everyone!

I've been aware of Philip Wadler's wonderful PLFA book and the previous effort of writing its proofs in Lean since quite a while ago, but I didn't have the time to have a look in detail until very recently...

So in the past few months I have been reading the book and following along using Lean 4 (https://github.com/rami3l/plfl), and I have just reached the end. Maybe you will find this interesting if you are interested in Software Foundations :)

Many thanks to the Lean community here for helping me out when I got stuck :pray: (you'll find some Zulip links in the codebase as references :D)

PS: This is my first experience in doing non-trivial proofs in Lean, so code reviews are welcome!

IMO Volume 1 on Logical Foundations is pretty much covered by the official Lean tutorial TPIL4, so I chose not to include that part of the code in the repo.

Also, the idea that I had when doing this is getting me to know more about both Lean and mathlib, so I have used mathlib4 constructs when appropriate. (Don't hesitate to tell me if you think something is missing!)
